bugs.title: CVE-2017-6542 putty: Integer overflow in the ssh_agent_channel_data

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-6542 putty: Integer overflow in the ssh_agent_channel_data

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that putty is vulnerable to an integer overflow. An attacker could overwrite the heap data with his own if the system has SSH agent forwarding and he is able to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection.

Upstream patch:

https://git.tartarus.org/?p=simon/putty.git;a=commitdiff;h=4ff22863d895cb7ebfced4cf923a012a614adaa8

References:

http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/wishlist/vuln-agent-fwd-overflow.html

Created putty tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-5 [bug 1431718]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1431719]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1431720]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that putty is vulnerable to an integer overflow. An attacker could overwrite the heap data with his own if the system has SSH agent forwarding and he is able to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection.

Upstream patch:

https://git.tartarus.org/?p=simon/putty.git;a=commitdiff;h=4ff22863d895cb7ebfced4cf923a012a614adaa8

References:

http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/wishlist/vuln-agent-fwd-overflow.html

Created putty tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-5 [bug 1431718]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1431719]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1431720]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of epel-6.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1431716

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: putty crash when middle mouse pressed over connected window

bugzilla.short_desc: putty crash when middle mouse pressed over connected window

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1294997
coredump-putty.txt

Description of problem:

I've been receiving reproducable crashes with putty after connecting to some ssh server.

Once connected you can do normal operations inside the window like entering commands etc... Then I wanted to use the middle mouse (scrollwheel) to scroll the window up and down to review some longer output.

The window turns "white" instantly and never recovers. Clicking around inside there will cause putty to crash afterwards.


Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

-bash-4.4$ rpm -q putty
putty-0.69-1.fc26.x86_64
-bash-4.4$ 


How reproducible:
See above or below :)


Steps to Reproduce:
1. Connect to a remote ssh server
2. Press middle mouse within the window or use the mousewheel to scroll up or down.
3. Screen turns white and if you continue some mouse presses you end up in a crash.


Actual results:
Crashes!


Expected results:
Definately no crashes and proper redrawing of the window. Mouse wheel should be able to scroll up and down.

Additional info:
Please find attached a full bt will debuginfo enabled!

Fixed in upstream:

https://git.tartarus.org/?p=simon/putty.git;a=commit;h=12bd5a6c722152aa27f24598785593e72b3284ea

https://git.tartarus.org/?p=simon/putty.git;a=commit;h=64221972c

putty 0.70 released which should cover and fix this issue...

Please provide an updated package...
Thanks for info.
